primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God seeks out and rescues humanity from the self-destructive lie of the Serpent by substituting Himself on the 'tree' of the cross.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord God called to the man, 'Where are you?'
Jesus reverses the work of the Serpent.
Jesus Christ is going to take the lie out of your heart through a tree.
root the lie out of your heart
clothe you the way the love of Christ will
God is saying... I want you not to eat the tree just because I’m asking you not to, just because you love me.
that cross becomes a tree of life for you and me.
He used the tree of death to make it a tree of life.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the one applying the 'beholding' of Christ.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Serpent / The Lie of Distrust / Self-centeredness (Incurvatus in se)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Serpent has targeted belief in the love of God.
human nature is incurvatus se... curved in on itself.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but a fundamental ontological 'curve' and a cosmic deceiver that renders the human incapable of trusting God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to create a self-made identity and righteousness (the 'fig leaf' program).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Adam & Eve
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is exposed as a failure and a symptom of sin, which only the primary program (God's action) can resolve.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God gives the first man and the first woman a command.
He comes out and seeks them in love.
God putting himself in our place.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You take your life into your own hands.
We use all things, even God, for our own sake.

voorbeelden: You must not eat from the tree.
What the Serpent goes after... you can't trust God.
Do you know what's in your heart?
The pitiful fig leaves of your own making will never, ever actually clothe you.
Salvation is God taking your place.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of 'pouvoir' (inability to clothe oneself or trust God) and God's 'pouvoir' to save via substitution.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Paradise) to ~S1 (The Lie/Sin) to S2 (Death/Shame), resolved by God moving from S2 to ~S2 (Seeking) and finally absorbing S2 on the Cross to restore S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary Atonement: God takes S2 (Death) so the Receiver gets S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death and 'crushing' are presented as the necessary cost of the resolution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects moralism by defining sin as 'being your own savior' and placing the agency of salvation entirely on God's initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What are you going to do about it?

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject in Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He doesn’t descend in fire and judgment. Instead, he comes out and seeks them in love.
Salvation is God taking your place and my place.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Adam is used as a 'Negative Type' (First Adam) rather than a moral example to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric/Christocentric reading (Second Adam).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhaustion' of self-salvation; shift from fear to trust.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God is the sole actor in the fundamental program.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Root' (Distrust) to the 'Solution' (God's trustworthiness on the cross) is perfectly integrated.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Salvation is God putting himself in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the objective work of Christ; the subjective application is 'beholding'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical. Sin is seen as a totalizing 'curve' of the soul that co-opts even morality.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented narrative structure. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'Savoir-faire' of the Spirit's role.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase emphasis on the Spirit's power to enable the 'beholding'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Mention how the Spirit opens the eyes to see the beauty of the cross.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as a cosmic lie and internal curvature.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology correctly precedes and grounds the (minimal) ethical appeal.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful deconstruction of moralism that uses the Actantial model's 'Subject-Switch' (from Man to God) to proclaim the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'New Yorker' illustrations, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the substitution of the Subject (Christ for Adam).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew context of Genesis 3; this analysis shows how the sermon functions as a 're-narratization' of the hearer's life into God's story.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'being moral' is identified as an 'Opponent' to trust, which is a deep-structural insight not always visible on the surface.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (commanded, gives, says, calls, seeks, counsels, takes place)
Jesus (reverses, takes lie, climbs tree, took punishment)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Second Adam' motif to ensure the Subject of the narrative remains God even when discussing human failure.
